title: Solved: Three Font IDs on Logo
content:
Hello again Typophiles! I could use some help on the IDs of the 2 fonts in the logo below. I am a noob when it comes to matching fonts, and any help would be greatly appreciated and save me the work in Illustrator.

Thank you guys for you help to date!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072613im_/http:/typophile.com/files/websiteLogo_4971.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072613im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Cape_Henry_Collegiate_School_Seal_6519.jpg)

Font: 

 Helvetica Neue, Poetica, & Palatino 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072613/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: CRAFT

comments.content:
Cape Henry: [Palatino](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072613/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/palatino/)/ [Zapf Calligraphic 801](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072613/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/zapf+calligraphic+801) by Hermann Zapf  
COLLEGIATE: [Helvetica Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica)

Thank you Ryuk for the quick response! Though, I apologize for the ambiguous ID request, I was also seeking the ID of the font used within the crest.

Thank you again for your help on the main fonts.

::Bump::

Can anyone ID the font within the School's Crest? " **Mundi Novi Scientlae, Founded in 1914"**

::Bump::

Can anyone ID the font within the School's Crest? " **Mundi Novi Scientlae, Founded in 1914"**

::Bump::

Can anyone ID the font within the School's Crest? " **Mundi Novi Scientlae, Founded in 1914"**

Sorry for the triple bump, I've been having issues with the forum loading pages.

I'm still looking for the font inside the crest if anyone is willing to help!

Thanks again.

-CRAFT
